channel.title: internet on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in internet on Barefoot Rob

item.title: Dear Congressman Ted Poe
item.description: 08:49 Saturday 26 May 2018 JST Please support Net Neutrality. Otherwise, you are going to have to pay to get your message out to constituents. In short, I want you and all your fellow member of congress to vote the opposite of whatever Ajit Pai suggests. As you can see on the ArsTechnica(1) website, Pai’s so-called “light-touch approach” of the previous 20 years actually consisted of much heavier regulation than exists today.

item.title: Dear FCC
item.description: 08:45 Thursday 11 May 2017 JST Dear FCC, The FCC should stand up for Internet users by safeguarding net neutrality. The FCC should reject Chairman Ajit Pai’s proposal to hand the ISP monopolies like Comcast, Verizon, and AT&T the authority to create Internet fast lanes, stripping consumers of the necessary privacy and access protections we demanded and so recently won. I’m concerned about ISPs being allowed to discriminate against certain types of data or websites because I would like my small business to have a fair chance of success.

item.title: proofread your newsletters before sending them
item.description: ##18:38 Thursday 04 April 2013 6:28pm Thursday 4 April 2013 I got a newsletter from Kii recently. I appreciate that the view online link is nicely mangled, and that I can unsubscribe with a click. Link to funny kii newsletter. The newsletter I received includes this “sample text” Hi Rob, Describe what you have to offer the customer. Why should they read? What did you promise them in the subject line?

item.title: new server for AB
item.description: ##10:57 Saturday 30 March 2013 10:55am Saturday 30 March 2013 Came in to work today to move AB from server which we didn’t totally control to one which we control a lot more. We still don’t have to touch the hardware, but now we have sudo access as needed. The move was smooth; the longest part was waiting for DNS to update.

item.title: time to post an xkcd comic
item.description:
##08:00 Saturday 30 March 2013 7:47am Saturday 30 March 2013 This image at https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/time.png been changing since it was posted on 25 March 2013.
Thanks to @Aubron Wood for this replay of the xkcd Time scene so far. Explanation of xkcd Time at explainxkcd

item.title: my floating virtual lego blocks
item.description: ##18:52 Sunday 24 March 2013 6:44pm Sunday 24 March 2013 After reading on HN that Google has discontinued Blocked Sites, I was browsing through the extensions available for Chrome, and found Build With Chrome. My creation hasn’t been approved yet, but it’s apparently visible if you click Rob’s floating v-shaped Lego thing. It looks something like this

item.title: hey DJ
item.description: ##16:16 Saturday 02 March 2013 I miss DJing; that was so much fun. I just enjoyed communicating with Tom at KTRU during his Saturday midnight shift. He played a song for me, which was awesome, though I didn’t know it was for me until he mentioned it hahahaha.

item.title: ycombinator looks down from here
item.description: ##14:50 Monday 18 February 2013 oh nooooes

item.title: Safari has become better for searching, but harder for sharing
item.description: ##10:27 Sunday 17 February 2013 Regarding the new Safari search bar: I’m glad that I can just type keywords and Safari knows I’m not trying to search for the invalid URL https://funny%20cat%20videos But now all I see is “funny cat videos” where I would like to see the URL https://www.google.com/search?q=funny+cat+videos The interwebs are based on the concept of hyperlinks, not hypersearchterms. It’s a pain for me now to use Safari to create links for sharing.

item.title: I love the internettes (xkcd editor)
item.description:
##13:14 Wednesday 13 February 2013 Now we can make our own XKCD style comics!
Edit as you like!

item.title: late late final night before Ma and Fred go home
item.description: ##03:03 Thursday 10 January 2013 2:51am Thursday 10 January 2013 as I write this. Just now about to go to bed after chatting with Lin a bit about the best way to get Ma and Fred to Shinagawa station. She wanted to rent a car to Shinagawa, but I think a simple taxi ride one way to Kawasaki will be faster and cheaper overall. Chatted with Fred at the monthly apartment while he packed.

item.title: printed calendar pages
item.description: ##21:51 Monday 07 January 2013 Thank you calendarlabs for saving me several hours of work. I printed 12 monthly calendars on A4 size pages including Japanese holidays. Nice.

item.title: installed Alfred app
Colleen's painting on koalastothemax
item.description: ##07:56 Thursday 03 January 2013 I put an in-progress snapshot of Colleen’s painting on Koalas to the max. Each time mouse cursor enters a circle, the circle will split into 4 circles, slowly revealing the picture (down to 7 levels of splits). How many circles are in a fully revealed image? (I think it’s 4^7, or 16384) I posted an image in the Koalas to the Max! thread on trackmill forums

item.title: Ferp sherd me derp herper
item.description: ##10:42 Sunday 30 December 2012 Thanks to https://www.jwz.org/herpderp/ for writing a comment herp derper. It’s on by default here now. Funny funny JS to make it go:

item.title: speaking of countdowns
item.description: ##22:40 Friday 21 December 2012 Nice job, Ryan!!! https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/breadpig/to-be-or-not-to-be-that-is-the-adventure 9 minutes to go; click now!!

item.title: Windows Store apps support the >iframe< element
item.description: ##09:20 Thursday 20 December 2012 I wonder if >iframe< was intentionally reverse-bracketed, or if someone forgot it should be <iframe> in the source. Screenshot from: https://www.windowsstore.com/developers/web (about 4/5ths of the way down the page)

item.title: "feedback" on webpage hack pull request
item.description: ##18:01 Thursday 13 December 2012 Also, this was hilarious: https://github.com/CoderDojo/CoderDojo-Kata/pull/1/files

item.title: I'm glad Apple canned Google's map app, and more glad that Google's map app is back
item.description: ##17:46 Thursday 13 December 2012 I imagine if Apple had kept Google’s original map app, Google wouldn’t have utterly redesigned its new map app, which is beautiful. Thanks to HN, I found Sacha Greif’s nice writeup on Google’s map app.

item.title: having a lot of fun playing (too much) Minecraft
item.description:
##21:19 Thursday 06 December 2012
This is a view from inside the hole I’m digging as part of a Minecraft art project I’ve got in mind. I plan to put a stop-action animation of the hole being dug on youtube. Earlier, while researching stuff for work, I found bigdinosaur.org, on which a blog entry was posted about something work related. mySQL or Javascript or some such. Anyway, in the side bar he mentioned he liked Minecraft.

item.title: This URL will not exist in 2022
item.description:
##21:20 Saturday 24 November 2012 Not this URL, but this one: https://www.longbets.org/601/, or so the bettor suggests. I’m sure the URL will work fine, along with its friend https://longbets.org/601/ as well as future URIs in to-be-developed retrieval systems. Anyway, I just thought the bet was interesting, so I took a couple screenshots.
I wonder if the URL for this blog entry will still work; I’ve been debating ditching Wordpress for another home built system, perhaps using an upgraded version of my old system.

item.title: Hand-painted palm-sized elephant
item.description: ##12:20 Sunday 18 November 2007 Animals painted on hands Originally uploaded by thunderrabbit This is my favorite of several images that my mom emailed me and I posted on flickr

item.title: new Castle of Dreams map
item.description: ##23:39 Thursday 08 November 2007 new Castle of Dreams mapOriginally uploaded by thunderrabbit I sketched this map at work as I was planning to make a [navigation /] extension for MediaWiki that would allow me to make a “map” out of a wiki

item.title: qwantz.com - dinosaur comics - August 22 2007
item.description: ##13:01 Tuesday 23 October 2007 qwantz.com - dinosaur comics - August 22 2007 HAHAHAHAHAHAAAA!!!! Blogged with Flock Tags: funny, funny, funny

item.title: 3G in Japan vs stagnation in the US
item.description: ##13:58 Wednesday 03 January 2007 Regarding WiFi in Japan vs the US, Jesse wrote: We already have 4G in Japan…. and it is already too slow but boasts speeds of 100mbps. 3g is only good for non-mobile systems. It only goes a max of 384kbps for mobile systems, and that is if it has a good connection… Dude explained: beacause the US is so concerned with “preserving the free market”, our government refuses to mandate a standard.

item.title: 43things.com
item.description: ##02:10 Tuesday 25 July 2006 43things.com This site is a pretty cute semi-waste of time. At least that is my first impression, but definitely a good idea. I hope it helps inspire some people (and me) to do cool things!! technorati tags:43things Blogged with Flock

item.title: youos.com
item.description: ##02:09 Tuesday 25 July 2006 youos.com This site is awesome. What a killa dilla idea! And it’s all written in javascript!! Blogged with Flock

item.title: writely
item.description: ##18:44 Tuesday 11 July 2006 writely.com Writely, the online word/blog processor, allows one to read/write/upload/save/collaborate text documents online, including, apparently, posting to one’s blog, which I am testing now.Props to writely crew for doing such a good job that Google has recently scooped them up in its plan to replace local storage with infinite storage online.Registration to writely is closed, except via invitation. Special props to Piet for inviting me!

item.title: Ice Cream!!!!!!
item.description: ##02:41 Tuesday 11 July 2006 Although ice cream can be easy to make at home, it is actually a very complex substance. In this article, we’ll learn how it’s made, what goes into it, and who invented it. Howstuffworks “How Ice Cream Works” Wow! I never knew the complexities of ice cream! Blogged with Flock

item.title: 88Slide
item.description: ##13:45 Friday 30 June 2006 88SLIDE: The Daily One Minute Trivia Challenge Holy shit she is hot!!!!! technorati tags:hot Blogged with Flock

item.title: Google Click-to-Call
item.description: ##13:41 Thursday 24 November 2005 Google foots the bill for all calls - local and long-distance. Google Click-to-Call Holy shinoli!!! How can this be abused? How can they afford it? Woah.

item.title: geotagged post?
item.description: ##01:36 Sunday 13 November 2005 This is the first post I’ve written after installing Ravi’s GeoPress - Wordpress Plugin for tagging your posts with location. I have put my West Gray address below this entry, and labled it 1211WGray. Clicked Embed Map and Save this location. Now clicking publish…. No embedded map.. I wonder if it’s a problem with the string I put in the address field. It was “1211 West Gray, Houston, Texas, 77019” I’m going to change it to “77019” and publish again.

item.title: YouTube
item.description: ##18:32 Tuesday 08 November 2005 Just found a new site called YouTube, which has just received funding, which means to me they could have a good thing going. The front of the site looks so much like google and gmail’s front page that my brain thought it must be associated with google. Sign up by clicking here and I’ll get a referral. I’m quite impressed with the site. I just uploaded two videos; it made thumbnails, permalinks; gave me HTML code to embed videos on my pages… and it’s fast and free.

item.title: Free Wi-Fi
item.description: ##03:19 Friday 28 October 2005 Google proposed to build an IEEE 802.11b/g Wi-Fi mesh network that delivers more than 1 megabit per second of capacity throughout the city. PCWorld.com - Google Describes its Wi-Fi Pitch This would be pretty fresh… A city where we could just walk around and be connected… This would drive a market for cameras that upload to a blog and realtime wearable video cameras… Wow.

item.title: Flock!!
item.description: ##06:44 Tuesday 25 October 2005 Oh my gosh Flock is getting even cooler!!? And by “getting cooler” I mean I am discovering more features that have been here all along! I’m writing this blog entry without being connected to the internet.? I wrote the one on Patch Adams, and then carefully saved the text so I could close flock and not lose what I wrote, but then when I open it back up…?

item.title: from within flock
item.description: ##00:58 Saturday 22 October 2005 A few minutes after downloading, (given that I’ve already got a blog set up (thanks, Dude!)) I am writing to my blog from flock’s interface. I sure hope they don’t abuse my password which I’ve given to my flock browser. I think I should be able to do things with the blog entries listed in the flock blog window (like edit the one on flock instead of having

item.title: flock
item.description: ##06:53 Friday 21 October 2005 flock.com promises to be a new type of web browser, which breaks the concept of just being a single user in search of the last page of the internet. It’s supposed to let people’s browsing experiences merge together in some sort of internetally related hyperweb (I just made that term up) of similar interests that organically come out of browsing and linking slash bookmarking things we like.

item.title: Google Earth
item.description: ##01:05 Friday 21 October 2005 Wow. Google Earth rules. I am 99% certain I have found Scott, my favorite car parked at my office at FSD about 3 or 4 years ago in Houston. That is awesome. I sent a ‘bookmark’ to myself (and Dude and Fred); I wonder if I can post it in here somehow.

item.title: automatic image categorisation
item.description: ##03:39 Tuesday 04 October 2005 automatic image categorisation This seems pretty sweet. Google could use this technology to further optimize its image search. I could use this technology to get the pictures on my website arranged! Amazing to imagine that we are now living in a time that computers don’t recognize what’s in photographs. Seriously.

item.title: Google To Buddy Up With NASA
item.description: ##02:37 Friday 30 September 2005 Schmidt’s Google To Buddy Up With NASA - Forbes.com This one looks pretty damn cool. According to another article, Google will open up a million square feet worth of office space in NASA Ames research center. My goodness it would be good to have a few hundred GOOG shares right about now. Barring that, I look foward to seeing Google Mars and Google Moon. I want to see how they represent the alien station on the far side of the moon.

item.title: Skype - The whole world can talk for free.
item.description: ##04:51 Thursday 29 September 2005 Skype - The whole world can talk for free. Skype rules. skype to skype calls are always freeeee!!! Calls from Skype to phones are amazingly inexpensive!!!! Download Skype!!

item.title: roachfiend.com Â» BugMeNot
item.description: ##04:23 Thursday 29 September 2005 roachfiend.com Â» BugMeNot This awesome extension is like a dream come true for getting into free registration sites. mailinator.com is quite nice, but this is even faster. btw, mailinator has a cool new look and more functionality, such as a semi-realtime spam map, showing where the most spam is coming from right now….
